column1: # Create a new line for each processor type.

All simulations were performed on the Pitzer Cluster at the Ohio Supercomputer Center
The reported compute time is taken as the walltime times the number of processors (core hours).
Pitzer has a mix of processors. We did not specify the processor type upon submission
All of the calculations were performed during a trial period during the cluster expansion.
The original Pitzer cluster was installed in late 2018 and

column2: Intel Xeon Skylake processor-based supercomputer with 260 nodes.
OSC installed an additional 398 Intel Xeon Cascade Lake processor-based

column1: # Use as many lines of text as you need.
# All text following the 'Method:' keyword will be regarded as part of your free text methods description.
Solvation free energy calculations were performed using electronic structure calculations using the SM12 continuum
solvation model in water and 1-octanol. All calculations were performed using QChem/5.3.

column2: geometry optimizations were performed at the M062X/6-31+G(d
column3: p) level of theory/basis set in vacuum.

column1: This vacuum optimized geometry was then used to perform single point energy calculations in vacuum
and in the solvents at the same level of theory/basis sets.
The uncertainty in the solvation free energy calculations was taken to be 0. Given a fixed geometry
the computed single point energy calculations should remain unchanged. The model uncertainty
was taken from our untrained SM12 submission in the SAMPL6 challenge
RMSE in logP to a RMSE in TFE in kcal/mol.
